name: Lemon Pound Cake
description: This delicious, moist and easy lemon pound cake recipe is made with fresh lemon juice and zest, and perfect for dessert or paired with coffee or tea.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup room temperature salted butter (plus more for greasing) ($2.01)
1.5 cups all-purpose flour (plus more for dusting) ($0.22)

recipeInstructions.text: Place an oven rack in the center of your oven and preheat the oven to 350¬∞F. Grease an 8.5x4.5-inch (1.5 qt) loaf pan with butter. Line the pan with parchment. Butter the parchment and dust with flour, shaking off excess flour.
recipeInstructions.name: Place an oven rack in the center of your oven and preheat the oven to 350¬∞F. Grease an 8.5x4.5-inch (1.5 qt) loaf pan with butter. Line the pan with parchment. Butter the parchment and dust with flour, shaking off excess flour.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the butter and sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add the beaten eggs, buttermilk,  1/4 cup lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon zest. Mix until incorporated.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the butter and sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add the beaten eggs, buttermilk,  1/4 cup lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon zest. Mix until incorporated.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flour mixture to the butter and egg mixture in thirds, mixing after each addition and scraping down the sides before the next addition.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flour mixture to the butter and egg mixture in thirds, mixing after each addition and scraping down the sides before the next addition.

recipeInstructions.text: Add batter to the prepared pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated 350¬∞F oven until the cake springs back when you press the center and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Add batter to the prepared pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated 350¬∞F oven until the cake springs back when you press the center and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pound cake from the oven and cool for ten minutes before removing it from the pan and placing it on a cooling rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the pound cake from the oven and cool for ten minutes before removing it from the pan and placing it on a cooling rack.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the glaze, mix the powdered sugar with 2 tablespoons lemon juice and 1 1/2 teaspoons lemon zest.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the glaze, mix the powdered sugar with 2 tablespoons lemon juice and 1 1/2 teaspoons lemon zest.

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle the glaze on the cooled pound cake and serve!
recipeInstructions.name: Drizzle the glaze on the cooled pound cake and serve!

review.reviewBody: This is a fairly dense, moist, and very zingy cake! And not too finicky, which is what I look for in all baking recipes. üòÅ I brought this in to work to say thank-you to a coworker who‚Äôs been sharing their lemon tree‚Äôs largesse, and it DISAPPEARED in a few hours. A hit all around!
My first time baking a Lemon pound cake! The taste is lemony, the firmness was on point.  Above all it is delicious.  Would make it again.
delicious and easy to make! didn't put on lemon glaze as we had fresh strawberries, thawed cool whip then used your recipe for pound cake. lemon juice definitely gave more flavor. thank you bb :)

I'm a pretty experienced baker and have no issue with much more finicky recipes, but this one came out with an awful texture and very little flavor. 

If I adjusted this, I'd suggest softening the butter just past room temp (such as under a warm glass) and adding additional flour (1tbsp at a time) if needed until you get the consistency in the photos. 

I'd agree that an 8x4 pan would not hold this much batter. I ended up using a standard 9x5 and still having some leftover.
This recipe is perfect! I have a pic of it, too, but I don't know if I can post it here. So simple and delicious. The larger portions of butter in this recipe make it heavenly!
perfect! thanks for another great recipe!

Maybe! I'm not entirely sure what happened but I did manage to salvage the loaf by quickly dumping it into a 9x5 pan. It was my fault because I shouldn't have even bothered trying to bake it in the other pan knowing it was so full. Maybe it was 8x4 but not the same depth as your pan. 

Once it was in the bigger pan, it still came out perfectly! Knowing now which of my pans to use, I'll definitely be making this again because it was delicious! Lesson learned on my part üôÇ don't attempt to bake in an overfull pan! Thank you for the response and also for the awesome recipe!

I was looking for a simple but summery baking project, and I'm so glad I tried this one! It was simple, but delicious. The lemon was really bright, and the cake itself was rich and buttery. Can't wait for leftovers toasted with a bit of butter (my absolute favorite way to eat pound cake! glad to see it mentioned here).
Delicious! I found I got enough juice and zest with two lemons but now I have one extra. :) The batter and finished product smelled so good!
